results.title: Farming 2000
results.brief_description: Covers a conference held in 1983 by the Australian Rural Adjustment Unit and the National Farmers Federation. The conference examined the major issues facing rural Australia during the 1980’s.

results.title: Farm tractor safety
results.brief_description:
Produced by the U.S Department of Agriculture. Follows a community as they confront the high amount of tractor-related injuries that are occuring and discover ways to counter them.

Largely set at a town meeting where addresses are given by various experts on the dangers of tractors and how to operate them safely. This culminates in an address by a man who lost both his hands in an accident.

Film contains numerous shots of tractors toppling over in varying situations.

results.title: Farm boy of Hungary
results.creator_credit: Gabor Kalman and Vue Touristique Film Studios
results.brief_description: The pace, feel, and values of the rural way of life that is still a part of Central Europe today. Lajos, a farm boy, is shown living the normal life in Hungary. Modern conveniences may be lacking, but Lajos and his family “have everything we need”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gabor Kalman and Vue Touristique Film Studios

results.title: Fantasia Di Botticelli: La Calunnia
results.creator_credit: Carlo Carlo Ludovico Ragghianti and Romor Film
results.brief_description: The Florentine painter Sandro Botticelli was one of the greatest products of the Renaissance. His sinuous and telling outlines are so exceptionally decorative and expressive that they place his work amongst the finest creations in the history of art. His admiration of classical art is most powerfully evident in his recreation of “Calumny”, a lost masterpiece painted by a Greek artist Apelles in the third Century B.C. “The Calumny” is the centre point of the film around which the developing style of Botticelli is examined.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Carlo Carlo Ludovico Ragghianti and Romor Film

results.title: Family matters
results.creator_credit: Robert Van der Vvyer and Jenny Drew
results.brief_description: The twelve months after the first baby arrives can be a crucial time in a couple’s relationship. The twosome becomes a threesome, and much of a couple’s time and energy is directed towards caregiving, with possible misunderstandings and resentments occurring if each partner does not understand how the other is feeling.

results.title: Facts about film (1959)
results.creator_credit: Robert Longini and Visual Education Films
results.brief_description: Indicates the proper use of film and projectors, how to maintain and repair film, and what causes film damage. Deals with such matters as threading of film in projector, splicing and the ways in which film may be scratched.

results.title: Faces in a crowd
results.creator_credit: Roger Dunton, David Powell and Abacus Documentaries
results.brief_description: Looks at the city of London and shows how the Port and the city are complementary, mutually supporting a vast trading complex. This relationship is largely revealed in this film in terms of people - working people - in the markets, for which the city is justly famous.
